intro: Amblyanthera torosa, commonly known as the twisted anther plant, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its unique, twisted flower stems and small, delicate pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Amblyanthera torosa is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its distinctive morphology and limited distribution.
